## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see <https://quarto.org>.

## Running Code

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

You can add options to executable code like this 

```{r}
#| echo: false
2 * 2
```

The `echo: false` option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).



#librerias
```{r}
library(googlesheets4)
library(tidyverse)

```

#extraccion de datos

```{r}
url <- "https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/15r7ZwcZZHbEgltlF6gSFvCTFA-CFzVBWwg3mFlRyKPs/edit?gid=172957346#gid=172957346"

gs <- url %>% 
  as_sheets_id()

fb <- gs %>% 
  range_read("fb")

str(fb)

```



#modelo?
> Dise√±o factorial en bloques completos al azar

$$ tubdw = \mu + riego + genotipo + riego*genotipo + bloque + e$$

En ciencias agrarias usamos el pvalue < 0.05
y en medicina pvalue < 0.01

```{r}
md <- aov(tubdw ~ riego + geno + riego*geno + bloque, data = fb)
anova(md)
```


# corregir base de datos
fb <- gs %>% 
```{r}
fb <- gs %>%
  range_read("fb") %>% 
  mutate(
    riego = as.factor(riego),
    geno = as.factor(geno),
    block = as.factor(block),
    bloque = as.factor(bloque)
  )


fb <- gs %>%
  range_read("fb") %>% 
  mutate(across(1;4, ~as.factor(.)))


str(fb)
```


```{r}
md <- aov(lfa ~ riego + geno + riego*geno + bloque, data = fb)
anova(md)

plot(md)

```

#comparacion de medias

```{r}
library(emmeans)
#comparacion de medias de geno dentro de cada nivel de riego
emm <- emmeans(md, ~ geno | riego)

emm
```
